question:
The charts show survey results concerning why MBA graduates did their degree, and employer's reasons for hiring them.

Summaries the information by selecting and reporting the main features, and make comparisons where relevant.
text: The pie charts above summarize the results of a survey conducted amid MBA graduates and employers. The firsts were asked to explain the reasons for doing an MBA, the seconds indicated the skills that they value most. While the 65% of the graduates chose to do an MBA to have better options on the labour market, only 10% of the employers recognize the values of qualifications.

According to the survey, 50% of the employers were equally divided in thinking that the personality and the knowledge value most in the workplace, the 20% gained importance to the employee's presentation, followed those who underlined the importance of previous experiences; as mentioned, only one in ten of the interviewees valued most the qualifications.

On the other hand, the 65% of the graduates think that the reason to choose an MBA are the better job opportunities granted by this qualification, the remaining 35% was divided by a 15% who thought that an MBA could give a better ability to do the job; a 12% who pointed out the personal development as the main reason to choose the course and only 8% of the former students said that the best reason to take an MBA is the ability to help others.
